info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 27 at 12:49AM EDT until October 27 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Broward.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen over the past couple hours. Any additional rainfall may result in additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach, Plantation, Tamarac, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Wilton Manors, Sea Ranch Lakes, Lazy Lake, Twin Lakes, Golden Heights, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Franklin Park, Washington Park, St. George, Melrose Park, North Andrews Gardens and Rock Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
